Update API

This API is initialized with ConnectionOptions.

To create an instance of this API in Node.js:

var MbedCloudSDK = require("mbed-cloud-sdk");

var update = new MbedCloudSDK.UpdateApi({
    apiKey: "<Mbed Cloud API Key>"
});

To create an instance of this API in the browser:

<script src="<mbed-cloud-sdk>/bundles/update.min.js"></script>

<script>
    var update = new MbedCloudSDK.UpdateApi({
        apiKey: "<Mbed Cloud API Key>"
    });
</script>

Methods

addCampaign

  • addCampaign(campaign: AddCampaignObject): Promise<Campaign>

  • Add an update campaign

    Example:

    update.addCampaign({
    name: 'testCampaign',
    deviceFilter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        customAttributes: {
            attr1: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
            attr2: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
        }
    }
})
.then(campaign => {
    // Utilize campaign here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • campaign: AddCampaignObject

      The campaign to add

    Returns Promise<Campaign>

    Promise containing update campaign

  • addCampaign(campaign: AddCampaignObject, callback: CallbackFn<Campaign>): void

  • Add an update campaign

    Example:

    update.addCampaign({
    name: 'testCampaign',
    deviceFilter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        customAttributes: {
            attr1: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
            attr2: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
        }
    }
}, function(error, campaign) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize campaign here
});

    Parameters

    • campaign: AddCampaignObject

      The campaign to add

    • callback: CallbackFn<Campaign>

      A function that is passed the return arguments (error, update campaign)

    Returns void

addFirmwareImage

  • addFirmwareImage(image: AddFirmwareImageObject): Promise<FirmwareImage>

  • Add a firmware image

    Example (Node.js):

    var fs = require("fs");
...
update.addFirmwareImage({
    name: "<FirmwareImage name>",
    dataFile: fs.createReadStream("<FirmwareImage file path>")
})
.then(image => {
    console.log(image.url);
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Example (browser):

    <input type="file" id="file">
...
document.getElementById("file").addEventListener("change", event => {
    let file = event.target.files[0];

    updateApi.addFirmwareImage({
        name: file.name,
        dataFile: file
    })
    .then(image => {
        alert(image.url);
    })
    .catch(error => {
        console.log(error);
    });
});

    Parameters

    • image: AddFirmwareImageObject

      The image to add

    Returns Promise<FirmwareImage>

    Promise containing firmware image

  • addFirmwareImage(image: AddFirmwareImageObject, callback: CallbackFn<FirmwareImage>): void

  • Add a firmware image

    Example (Node.js):

    var fs = require("fs");
...
update.addFirmwareImage({
    name: "<FirmwareImage name>",
    dataFile: fs.createReadStream("<FirmwareImage file path>")
}, function(error, image) {
    if (error) return console.log(error);
    console.log(image.url);
});

    Example (browser):

    <input type="file" id="file">
...
document.getElementById("file").addEventListener("change", function(event) {
    var file = event.target.files[0];

    updateApi.addFirmwareImage({
        name: file.name,
        dataFile: file
    }, function(error, image) {
        if (error) return console.log(error);
        console.log(image.url);
    });
});

    Parameters

    • image: AddFirmwareImageObject

      The image to add

    • callback: CallbackFn<FirmwareImage>

      A function that is passed the return arguments (error, firmware image)

    Returns void

    Example (Node.js):

    name: "<FirmwareManifest name>",

    console.log(manifest.url);
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);

    Example (browser):

    <input type="file" id="file">
...

    updateApi.addFirmwareManifest({
        name: file.name,
        dataFile: file
    })
    .then(manifest => {
        alert(manifest.url);

        console.log(error);

        name: file.name,
        dataFile: file
    }, function(error, manifest) {
        if (error) return console.log(error);
        console.log(manifest.url);
    });

deleteCampaign

  • deleteCampaign(campaignId: string): Promise<void>

  • Delete an update campaign

    Example:

    update.deleteCampaign('015baf607c250000000000010010003d')
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • campaignId: string

      The ID of the update campaign to delete

    Returns Promise<void>

    Promise containing any error

  • deleteCampaign(campaignId: string, callback: CallbackFn<void>): void

  • Delete an update campaign

    Example:

    update.deleteCampaign('015baf607c250000000000010010003d', function(error) {
    if (error) throw error;
});

    Parameters

    • campaignId: string

      The ID of the update campaign to delete

    • callback: CallbackFn<void>

      A function that is passed the return arguments (error, void)

    Returns void

listCampaignDeviceStates

  • listCampaignDeviceStates(campaignId: string, options?: ListOptions): Promise<ListResponse<CampaignDeviceState>>

  • List campaign device states

    Example:

    update.listCampaignDeviceStates('015baf607c250000000000010010003d', {
    limit: 5,
})
.then(devicestates => {
    // Utilize devicestates here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • campaignId: string

      The ID of the update campaign

    • Optional options: ListOptions

      list options

    Returns Promise<ListResponse<CampaignDeviceState>>

listCampaigns

  • listCampaigns(options?: CampaignListOptions): Promise<ListResponse<Campaign>>

  • List update campaigns

    Example:

    update.listCampaigns({
    limit: 5,
    filter: {
        name: { $eq: "blinky" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
})
.then(campaigns => {
    // Utilize campaigns here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • Optional options: CampaignListOptions

      list options

    Returns Promise<ListResponse<Campaign>>

    Promise of listResponse

  • listCampaigns(options?: CampaignListOptions, callback?: CallbackFn<ListResponse<Campaign>>): void

  • List update campaigns

    Example:

    update.listCampaigns({
    limit: 5,
    filter: {
        name: { $eq: "blinky" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
}, function(error, campaigns) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize campaigns here
});

    Parameters

    • Optional options: CampaignListOptions

      list options

    • Optional callback: CallbackFn<ListResponse<Campaign>>

      A function that is passed the return arguments (error, listResponse)

    Returns void

updateCampaign

  • updateCampaign(campaign: UpdateCampaignObject): Promise<Campaign>

  • Update an update campaign

    Example:

    update.updateCampaign({
    name: 'testCampaign',
    id: '015baf607c250000000000010010003d',
    deviceFilter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        customAttributes: {
            attr1: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
            attr2: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
        }
    }
})
.then(campaign => {
    // Utilize campaign here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • campaign: UpdateCampaignObject

      The campaign to update

    Returns Promise<Campaign>

    Promise of campaign

  • updateCampaign(campaign: UpdateCampaignObject, callback: CallbackFn<Campaign>): void

  • Update an update campaign

    Example:

    update.updateCampaign({
    name: 'testCampaign',
    id: '015baf607c250000000000010010003d',
    deviceFilter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        customAttributes: {
            attr1: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
            attr2: { $eq: "custom_value_1" },
        }
    }
}, function(error, campaign) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize campaign here
});

    Parameters

    • campaign: UpdateCampaignObject

      The campaign to update

    • callback: CallbackFn<Campaign>

      A function that is passed the arguments (error, campaign)

    Returns void
